metadata.title: Tuesday, 14th October, 2014
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing whether the Government has any plans to maintain feeder roads that were constructed with support from the Danish International Development Agency (DANIDA).

parts: (a)    when the youth skills training centre in Kaputa District will be expanded to enable it cater for the increased number of youths in Kaputa and Nsama Districts; and
(b)    whether the Government has any plans to broaden the skills programmes being offered at the centre.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education whether the Government has any plans to provide solar power to the following primary schools in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)    Imilangu;
(b)    Ituya;
(c)    Ndoka;
(d)    Mayumbi; and
(e)    Lushi.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    whether detailed plans have been prepared for the construction of Mufuchani Bridge in Kwacha Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)    if so, whether the plans will be made public.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing whether the Government has any plans to construct shelters and public toilets at the harbours in Kalabo and Mongu Districts.

parts: (a)    when the construction of district administration offices in Limulunga will commence;
(b)    what the cost of the project is; and
(c)    what the duration of the works is.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when the Government will construct a modern bus station and a market in Sesheke Parliamentary Constituency.

parts: (a)    when Nakonde Central Police Station was built;
(b)    when the dilapidated Police Station will be rehabilitated;
(c)    whether the Government has any plans to construct female and juvenile cells at the Police Station; and
(d)    what the total cost of the projects at (b) and (c) is.
(a)    when the following items will be provided to the inmates at Katete State Prison:
(i)    uniforms; (ii)    mattresses; and (iii)    blankets;
(b)    when the kitchen at the Prison will be rehabilitated and modernised; and
(c)    when the two holding cells will be rehabilitated.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many boarding schools are in Bwacha Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)    when Mukobeko Secondary School will have boarding facilities to cater for pupils from far flung areas.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how much money was budgeted for the grading of feeder roads in Chipili Parliamentary Constituency from 2010 to 2014, year by year;
(b)    how many feeder roads were graded in the period above; and
(c)    whether the money was spent on the intended purpose.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Solwezi-Mwinilunga (T5) Road will be rehabilitated and expanded to cater for the increased flow of traffic as a result of mining activities.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a road to by-pass the Kitwe Central Business District from Kafue Bridge in Luangwa Township to Shombe Road via Kalulushi Airport to Sabina-Chingola Road;
(b)    if so, what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(c)    what the time-frame for executing the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Government will construct a bridge across Loanja River at Kalundu School in Mushukula Ward in Mwandi Parliamentary Constituency.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    whether any roads in Kaputa District have been included on the Link Zambia 8000 Road Project;
(b)    if so, what the names of the roads are;
(c)    when the tarrying exercise will commence; and
(d)    what the duration of the exercise is. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Supply - Motion (10th October) – Resumption of Debate.
